value.name: Loved and Lost: Carlos Garcia fixed everything, grew everything — except that avocado tree
value.description: Without Carlos Garcia, who will change the flat tires, hang the shelves and lay the pavers? Who will tend the garden, and shower family and friends with more cucumbers, tomatoes and lettuce than they can eat?

value.name: 1 year after George Floyd's death, Latino activists continue to seek police reform
value.description: The Black Lives Matter movement that reignited last year is one that the Latino community in Phoenix continues to support.

value.name: Phoenix Authorities Used 'ACAB' Slogan To Designate Protesters as a Gang
value.description: Umbrellas, black clothing, and chanting "all cops are bastards" signal criminal street gang membership, prosecutors said.

value.name: Phoenix police keep tabs on social media, but who keeps tabs on cops?
value.description: Phoenix police don’t follow Fe’La iniko on social media, but he knows they’re watching. “They’re pretty hip to Instagram,” the racial justice activist said. “Sometimes they’ll pop up in my story views.

value.name: Colombia protests enter fourth week, demonstrators pledge to continue
value.description: The protest, originally called in late April against a now-canceled tax plan, has expanded to include demands like a basic income, an end to police violence and opportunities for young people.

value.name: Phoenix approves civilian oversight office to investigate police misconduct claims
value.description: Phoenix's Office of Accountability and Transparency will investigate claims of police misconduct, including police shootings and in-custody deaths.

value.name: A $9-an-hour port-a-potty job helped her escape homelessness. Now she watches others struggle.
value.description: Dawn Woudenberg witnesses the pain on Salt Lake City’s streets as she works as a port-a-potty attendant across from the homeless shelter where she used to sleep.

value.name: Colombia protesters vow to carry on as demonstrations enter 4th week
value.description: A national strike committee has held several discussions with government representatives about protesters' demands, but there have been no formal talks yet.

value.name: Colombia protests stretch into fourth week, demonstrators vow to carry on
value.description: Colombia's wave of anti-government protests entered their fourth week on Wednesday, as unions, student groups and others turned out at marches to demand social change amid intermittent talks between the government and strike organizers.

value.name: John Oliver stands his ground against racist, needless stand your ground laws
value.description: With its twice-impeached figurehead currently scribbling nonsensically treasonous press releases during his time as a golf club greeter in Florida, John Oliver has had time of late to tackle white supremacy’s trickle-down effects all over the nation.
